results.title: Horowitz in Moscow
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Robert Dalrymple, Camivideo and Columbia Artists
results.brief_description: This video celebrates the return of Vladimir Horowitz to his home country, the Soviet Union, in 1986 to perform a musical recital at the Moscow Conservatory. It was to be the first important event in a series of cultural exchanges agreed to at the Geneva Summit in 1985. Horowitz calls himself an “ambassador of peace” as he talks to the media, his fans and his family. The biographical documentary captures the emotions of both Horowitz and his adoring fans as he performs some of his favourite compositions by such composers as Mozart, Chopin and Rachmaninov, among others. Interspersed throughout this demanding performance are images of Moscow, the people, streets and cityscape along with insightful interviews with Horowitz as he reminisces about his past. An absorbing and thoughtful documentary featuring some wonderful solo music played by one of the world’s best and highly regarded pianists.

results.title: The Rocky Horror picture show
results.creator_credit: Jim Sharman, Michael White and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The film begins with our innocent pair of lovers, Brad and Janet, stranded in a rain storm with the only available shelter being the weird Dr. Frank N. Furter mansion. Before the night is out Brad and Janet will lose their respective virginities to the Doctor, be introduced to his muscle-bound creation, Rocky, and battle the evil beings from the planet Transylvania. The plot is ridiculous, the music enjoyable and the whole thing is an outrageously good time. Possibly the most popular cult movie of all time and based on the original stage musical by Richard O’Brien. With Richard O’Brien, Susan Sarandon, Nell Campbell and Patricia Quinn all doing the “Time warp”. Tim Curry steals the show with an over-the-top performance as the sex mad Doctor.

results.title: Insomnia (1997)
results.creator_credit: Erik Skjoldbjaerg, Petter Borgli, Tomas Backstrom, Tom Remlov, Nordic Screen Production AS and Norsk Film
results.brief_description: Edgy police thriller set in Norway and the original version of this title. A police detective (Stellan Skarsgard) is flown in from Sweeden to a small rural town in Norway to help solve the murder of a teenage schoolgirl. In pursuit of the suspect in deep fog, his partner is shot and the accident leads the murderer to blackmail the detective. Due to the Midnight Sun and the stress of the situation he finds himself in, the detective suffers from insomnia which impacts on his judgement in dealing with his partner’s death. Tense and brooding the film questions the role of police as the enforcers of the law when they themselves are not above its constructs. Co-written and directed by Erik Skjoldbjaerg this is a compelling first-time feature. Cast includes Sverre Anker Ousdal, Bjorn Floberg, Gisken Armand, Maria Bonnevie.

results.title: Suddenly [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lewis Allen, Robert Bassler and Libra Productions
results.brief_description: Set in a sleepy US town by the name of “Suddenly”, an attractive war widow and mother of young son “Pidge” is pursued by the local sheriff Todd Shaw (Sterling Hayden) with romance in mind. Todd gets word that the President of the United States is to make an impromptu visit to the town and the FBI arrive to set up a secure perimeter around the railway station. Overlooking the station is the home of the widow Ellen (Nancy Gates) and her father-in-law (James Gleason), an ex-secret service agent. The film becomes a hostage drama as three gangsters lead by John Barron (Frank Sinatra) attempt to assassinate the president with a rifle from the house on the hill. The film provides a commentary on the role of the hand-gun in a post-world war America. Because of the similarity of the plot to real life, the film was withdrawn from general distribution after the assassination of JFK. Part of a two-disc set, with one disc being an Audio CD. Also contains a booklet with information and photos of Frank Sinatra.

results.title: The Shaggy dog
results.creator_credit: Charles Barton, Bill Walsh, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Family comedy film around the theme of fantasy and magic. The discovery of a magic ring changed young Wilby Daniels’ (Tommy Kirk) life forever. Suddenly he could transform himself into a large sheepdog - but the problem was he had no control as to when this was going to happen. Wilby did not need this in his life right now, just when he had his eye on the rather pretty Allison (Annette Funicello). He had to break the spell and the only way to do that was by performing some virtuous deed. Cast also includes Fred MacMurray, Jean Hagen, Tim Considine.

results.title: The Shaggy D.A.
results.creator_credit: Robert Stevenson, Bill Anderson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Sequel to Disney’s “The Shaggy Dog” (released 17 years earlier), this family comedy is full of slapstick moments and a plot that takes you from the world of reality to the fantastic and bizarre. Dean Jones stars as the now grown-up Wilby Daniels, who is campaigning to become a district attorney and Keenan Wynn plays his villainous arch-rival, John Slade. The campaign is turned on its head when Daniels is transformed into a sheepdog and Slade into a disgruntled bulldog and it becomes a contest between the two canines. Cast also includes Tim Conway, Suzanne Pleshette, Jo Ann Worley.

results.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sommers, Laurence Mark and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of the classic 19th century novel ‘The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn’ by American writer, Mark Twain. This is a story about Huck Finn (Elijah Wood), a poor uneducated boy who has run away from home to escape his abusive drunken father, and Huck’s chance encounter with Jim (Courtney S. Vance), an escaped slave. Together the two follow the Mississippi River finding adventure and drama and some rather dubious characters by the names of the King (Jason Robards) and the Duke (Robbie Coltrane). Cast also includes Ron Perlman and Laura Bundy.

results.title: JSA: Joint security area
results.creator_credit: Park Chan-Wook, Lee Eun, CJ Entertainment, KTB Network and Myung Film
results.brief_description: Powerful anti-war drama about an enquiry into the killing of two North Korean soldiers by a South Korean soldier on border patrol. Brought in to stifle a potentially incendiary situation, independent investigating officer Sophie Jean discovers that the group were once unlikely friends, sharing card games and good times. But subsequent enquiries reveal inconsistent versions of the tragic events that followed. A huge hit in Korea and Japan, “JSA” is a humanistic and sensitive examination of the discord between army officialdom and friendships amid supposed enemies. Adapted from the novel by Park Sang-myeon.

results.title: The Party's over = The Last party 2000
results.creator_credit: Donovan, Rebecca Chaiklin, Stanley F Buchthal, Camoflauge, Dakota Group and Palisades Pictures
results.brief_description: Philip Seymour Hoffman hosts an exploration of the state of politics in the United States, leading up to the 2000 election. Hoffman collects a variety of perspectives by attending a Farm Aid concert, various rallies, political conventions, a primary school, a NRA gun show, a Christian coalition, and prison towns. By interviewing the young and old, the famous and the obscure, the filmmakers strive to present a multifarious picture of America. Whilst the results are not polished, the work does capture the scandals of the election, including the faulty ballot cards, re-counts and the decision of the Supreme Court to appoint Bush. Interviews include Willie Nelson, Susan Sarandon, Noam Chomsky, and Michael Moore.

results.title: Mr. Hulot's holiday = M. Hulot's holiday [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tati, Fred Orain, Discana and Jerome Cady
results.brief_description: In the pipe-smoking daydreamer Mr. Hulot, Jaques Tati created one of the most adored and one of the funniest of screen clowns. In a sleepy seaside resort town, Hulot is the centre of increasing chaos: deckchairs behave anarchically, a summer Ball turns into a disaster. Amidst it all Mr. Hulot wanders around oblivious to the madness. “Mr. Hulot’s Holiday” is a beautifully orchestrated piece of comic cinema and widely considered Tati’s funniest film. Also available on VHS [303607].
